title: `unreachable expression` incorrectly detected in 1.15.0
body:
Upgrading from 1.14 to 1.15 I've found a case where the compiler generates `unreachable expression` which is false, I suspect because the only break out of a `loop {}` is from a macro.

Consider this repo (of which I'm the maintainer and can answer any questions about it): https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs

`master` should suffice, but you can also sync to `fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc` for a non-moving target and which will be the basis of the following links.

`cargo build` generates the unreachable expression in two locations, [here](https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs/blob/fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc/src/entity.rs#L569) and [here](https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs/blob/fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc/src/object.rs#L897).

The break out of these loops is in the form of the `next_pair!()` macro, defined [here](https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs/blob/fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc/src/helper_functions.rs#L373).

I can prove that this isn't an unreachable expression by [this test](https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs/blob/fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc/tests/entity_tests.rs#L281) which reads an `MText` entity which enters one of these supposedly non-terminating loops [here](https://github.com/IxMilia/dxf-rs/blob/fb4a9b5331cc35ee35c477702d6dc281896fc3fc/src/entity.rs#L510) and you can see that the only exit from this loop is the `next_pair!()` macro, but the test, which reads from this 'non-terminating' loop, does terminate because then it proceeds to continue on to read another entity.

Apologies for the convoluted nature of the code; it's a long story that I'll some day tell in my best Deckard Cain voice.
